title: Ticket #2743: condor_chirp put and putfile doesnt work on Windows
description:
the condor_chirp client and server don't support CONDOR_putfile and CONDOR_getfile, but condor_chirp.exe insists on using them to implement it's put function so condor_chirp put is broken on Windows.

In addition, the server side implementation of CONDOR_putfile opens the file for TEXT mode write, but the file is read and transmitted in BINARY mode, this tells the c-runtime write funtion to add a \r for every \n the write buffer.

Finally, the server (Starter) side of the chirp protocol has some parts of the protocol disabled with #ifdef WIN32 even though it might be talking to a Linux shadow that implements the full protocol.
